Game.Core

Class UnoGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Core.AbstractGame
      • Game.Core.UnoGame

  • public class UnoGame
extends AbstractGame
    UnoGame implements the logic to playing Uno, by using the Rules class and the GameState class a game of Uno Can be played. Handles reading input and the logic with dealing cards and switching turns.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    vikfll-0

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void addGameEndTransmit()
      If game ends the transmit is added to the players to notify of winner and then closes the game.
      private boolean canPlayCards(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardWantToPlay)
      Check rules if player can play the cards
      private void cardsPlayed(java.lang.String input)
      Handles the logic with the cards played Builds the card using the CardFactory and then uses the rules to check if cards can be played If they can then it calls method to process the cards.
      void checkUno(java.lang.String input)
      Check if uno was said, if it was said then check if player can say uno and react accordingly.
      private boolean checkWinner()
      Check if the activePlayer is the winner.

      Deal cards to the players, add internally to hand and add externally to the players transmit
      private void declinePlay()
      Transmit to player that the play was declined.
      remotePlayer getActivePlayer()
      Should return the active player that input is to be gathered from.
      void handleInput(java.lang.String input)
      Handles input from user, splits it up and determines what to do.
      private void nextPlayer()
      Tells the gamestate to change player for next turn and then calls the yourturn method to add to that players transmit to inform of turn to play.
      void processCards(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardsWantToPlay)
      Goes through the cards and processes them, tells player that play has been accepted.
      void setGameState(GameStateInterface gameState)
      Set the internal GameStateInterface to be used by the game.
      void setRules(RulesInterface rules)
      Set the rules to be used when playing the game.
      void startGame()
      Fetch the starting cards amount and Deal that amount of cards, then update the gamestates active card using the rules.
      private void transmitUno()
      Transmits that a player has said uno to the remaining players.
      private void YourTurn()
      Transmits to the player that it is the players turn, Also checks if the player can play on the upcoming turn otherwhise draws card for player until play can be done, Also draws card if need to penalize player exist.

        private void cardsPlayed(java.lang.String input)
        Handles the logic with the cards played Builds the card using the CardFactory and then uses the rules to check if cards can be played If they can then it calls method to process the cards.

      • YourTurn

        private void YourTurn()
        Transmits to the player that it is the players turn, Also checks if the player can play on the upcoming turn otherwhise draws card for player until play can be done, Also draws card if need to penalize player exist.

      • declinePlay

        private void declinePlay()
        Transmit to player that the play was declined.
